text: With YouTube and TikTok, dentists are trying to get Gen Z to show up - The Washington Post
fullText: Young adults are the most likely age group to skip dental care, with a recent study finding that one in three didn’t see a dentist during the previous year.

text: Walmart teams up with Google's Gemini to make it easier for shoppers to find and buy products - CNBC
fullText: The retail giant also has a similar deal with OpenAI's ChatGPT and has its own AI-powered chatbot, Sparky.

text: Walmart Expanding Drone Delivery to Hundreds More Stores - The Wall Street Journal
Trump tells Cuba to 'make a deal, before it is too late' - BBC
fullText: Trump has been turning his attention to Cuba since US forces seized Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro.

text: Bride and groom killed by gas explosion day after Pakistan wedding - BBC
fullText: Eight people were killed after a gas cylinder exploded at a house the morning after the wedding celebration.

text: Milan opening ceremony to include Bocelli, Carey - ESPN
fullText: Crossover tenor Andrea Bocelli and pop star Mariah Carey will be among the headline performers for the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics opening ceremony on Feb. 6.

text: Monumental tomb discovered in Turkey might be of royal from King Midas' kingdom - Live Science
fullText: A burial mound in Turkey may have held the remains of a member of King Midas's family. But not all experts are convinced.

text: How ICE raids in Minnesota connect to a years-old fraud scandal - NBC News
fullText: The Trump administration is using a years-old scandal first prosecuted under the Biden administration to justify its immigration crackdown in Minnesota.

text: Venezuela's exiles in Chile caught between hope and uncertainty - NPR
fullText: Initial joy among Venezuela's diaspora in Chile has given way to caution, as questions grow over what Maduro's capture means for the country — and for those who fled it.

text: Linus Torvalds' Latest Open-Source Project Is AudioNoise - Made With The Help Of Vibe Coding - Phoronix
fullText: In addition to Linus Torvalds' recent comments around AI tooling documentation, it turns out in fact that Linus Torvalds has been using vibe coding himself

text: Inside a Gaza medical clinic at risk of shutting down after an Israeli ban - NPR
fullText: A recent Israeli decision to bar Doctors Without Borders and other aid groups means international staff and aid can no longer enter Gaza or the West Bank. Local staff must rely on dwindling supplies and no international expertise.

text: He began an affair with the au pair. Then his wife and another man were killed in the bedroom - CNN
fullText: A Virginia man accused of plotting with his family’s au pair to kill his wife and another man, who had been lured to the home via a sexual fetish website, is set to face trial this week.

text: What's the oldest river in the world? - Live Science
fullText: The oldest river predates the dinosaurs. But how do we know this?

text: Inside GM's new world headquarters: Modernized midcentury designs with artifacts, surprises from the American icon - CNBC
fullText: GM has filled its new Detroit headquarters with artifacts, design nods and "Easter eggs" tied to the Detroit automaker's history.

text: Google’s Free Offer For 2 Billion Gmail Users—Should You Upgrade? - Forbes
fullText: You will now be upgraded unless you change your settings — what you need to know.

text: Where do Red Sox go from here after Bregman's Cubs deal? - MLB.com

BOSTON -- For the second consecutive winter, Alex Bregman was a hot topic at Fenway Fest without actually being there.

text: Smith seizes Matias' WBC belt with stunning KO - ESPN
fullText: Dalton Smith pulled off a stunning fifth-round knockout of Subriel Matias to become the WBC junior welterweight champion in a thrilling clash in Brooklyn.
